name: Stilton
description: Stilton has a beautiful interior, streaked like marble, and the texture is crumbly and almost soft - relatively delicate compared to its stout and bold flavours.

name: Swiss
description: Swiss cheese the generic name for several varieties of cheese originally made in Switzerland. In the United States 'swiss cheese' is an imitation of the Swiss Emmental or Emmentaler.

name: Ricotta
description: This soft, sweet, white cheese is made from what is left over after making other cheeses. Strictly speaking, ricotta is not really considered a cheese, but a latticino—which means a dairy by-product

name: Wensleydale
description: A Real Yorkshire Wensleydale is creamy-white in colour has a supple, crumbly, moist and flaky texture. It appears similar to a young Caerphilly. The flavour is mild, clean, and slightly sweet with hints of wild honey savour and fresh acidity.

name: Halloumi
description: Traditionally prepared from goat's and/or sheep's milk on the Eastern Mediterranean island of Cyprus, Halloumi is a white, layered cheese, similar to mozzarella. It is a semihard, unripened, and brined cheese with a slightly spongy texture.

name: Edam
description: Edam is a semi-hard cheese that originated in the Netherlands, and is named after the town of Edam in the province of North Holland

name: Gorgonzola
description: Gorgonzola is a straw-white, soft cheese with greenish streaks deriving from a process called “erborinatura” in Italian, that is the creation of moulds. This cheese is creamy and soft, with a peculiar, typical taste.
